trans-unit.source: Defines the basic functionality that represents the personalization data for a page.
Classes that derive from this base class contain the actual implementation for managing, applying, and extracting personalization data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartPersonalization> class makes use of personalization state with a reference to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState>.

If a developer writes a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> implementation, a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationProvider> must also be written.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationProvider> instances are responsible for creating and consuming <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> instances.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState"></xref> class.
The object created by this constructor manages the state for Web Parts controls that are managed by the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> that manages Web Parts controls that have personalization data.
The webPartManager parameter is `null`.
When overridden, applies personalization data to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control associated with the personalization state instance.

The associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control was a parameter in the constructor that created the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.
When overridden, applies personalization data to the specified Web Parts control.
This is the abstract definition of the method used to apply personalization data to a Web Parts control.
The Web Parts control to which personalization data is applied.
When overridden, extracts personalization information from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control associated with the current personalization state.

This is the abstract definition of a method used to extract personalization information from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.

The associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> was a parameter in the constructor that was used to create the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.
When overridden, extracts personalization data from the specified Web Parts control.
This is the abstract definition of the method used to extract personalization data from a Web Parts control.
The Web Parts control from which personalization data is extracted.
Retrieves the authorization filter for the specified Web Parts control.

This method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> string for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control before an instance of it is created.
This method should return `null` if there is no personalized value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> property.
The Web Parts control set does not implement any default behavior for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter%2A> property.

The property is provided so that a developer can assign an arbitrary string value to a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control; this property can be checked by subscribing to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.AuthorizeWebPart> event on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control on a page to determine whether the control can be added to the page.
The ID of the Web Parts control from which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.AuthorizationFilter"></xref> is retrieved.
The authorization filter string for a Web Parts control.
Gets a value that indicates whether any personalization information has changed.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartPersonalization> class checks this property to determine whether the personalization state needs to be written back to the underlying data store.
`true` if any personalization state instance has changed (is "dirty"); otherwise, `false`.
When overridden, gets a value that indicates whether any personalization state was extracted by a state instance.
This property is an abstract definition of a property that can be called to determine whether any personalization state was extracted by a state instance.
`true` if any personalization state was extracted by a state instance; otherwise, `false`.
Marks the current personalization state as having changed.

Classes that inherit from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> can use this method to mark themselves as having changed (or being "dirty"), thus indicating the need to reserialize and save personalization state.
When overridden, marks a Web Parts control as having changed.
This is an abstract definition of the method used to indicate that a Web Parts control has changed (is "dirty").

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> class exposes methods (which in turn call this method) that can be used by developers to mark a Web Parts control as "dirty," thus indicating the need to reserialize and save personalization state.
The Web Parts control to be marked as having changed.
When overridden, marks the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control as having changed.

This is the abstract definition of the method used to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> instance associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> instance is now considered to have changed (is "dirty").

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartPersonalization> class exposes a protected method (which in turn calls this method) that can be used by developers to mark the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control as "dirty," thus indicating the need to reserialize and save personalization state.
Verifies that the specified Web Parts control is valid.
This method verifies that `webPart` is a valid Web Parts control.

The base class verifies that `webPart` is not `null` and is managed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.

Classes that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> should validate Web Parts controls inside of any methods that work with <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> instances.
This ensures that standalone <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> instances do not have state changes accidentally written into the personalization data for a page.
The Web Parts control to be validated.
webPart is not currently managed by the associated with the .
webPart is `null.`
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> control currently associated with the personalization state instance.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control is the object used as a parameter for the constructor that creates the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState> object.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationState"></xref>.
